alert.note: Alert for Ross (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 17 at 11:23PM EST until February 18 at 3:48PM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers... Paint Creek at Bourneville. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Paint Creek at Bourneville. * WHEN...Until Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Flooding occurs on Alum Cliff Road and approaches Boswell Run Road. Lowland flooding occurs in Paxton and Twin Townships in Ross County. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:45 PM EST Thursday the stage was 12.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:45 PM EST Thursday was 12.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 12.7 feet Friday morning. It will then fall below flood stage late Friday morning. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay tuned to developments by listening to NOAA Weather Radio. For additional details on river forecasts, visit water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=iln
